intro: Tragia mitis var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the slender tragia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The leaves are alternate, ovate to oblong in shape, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique foliage and delicate flowers.
